title: Chris Ramsey thinks 'being sexy' will prove to be downfall on Strictly
text:
Chris and Karen are giving it their all on Strictly (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing’s Chris Ramsey reckons he’s in trouble on the show – as he potentially has to confront doing the ‘sexy’ dance routines.

The comedian doesn’t think he has it in him to act all serious and smouldering after becoming most known for his sense of humour and knack to head towards a joke.

‘When I’m going to be sexy, I’m going to be knackered. Doing the tango and that,’ Chris told Sunday Mirror.

‘It worries me big-time. And having to have an intense look on my face instead of pulling a stupid grin.’

This week, the stand-up star and pro partner Karen Hauer were put at the lower end of the leaderboard after only getting 25 points for their quickstep to Let’s Go Crazy by Prince.

So far, they’ve managed to avoid the ‘sexy’ dances like the rumba and the paso doble in favour of the more ‘fun’ side of ballroom – impressing with their Charleston and trying their luck with an Elton John jive.

Viewers will have to tune in tonight to see if they make it though to another week, with Mike Bushell and Katya Jones, and David James and Nadiya Bychkova also appearing to be in danger.

But after last week’s shock elimination of Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell, it can literally be anyone’s game at this point.

Will Bayley and Janette Manrara left the cast and the judges in tears with their contemporary performance that proved inspiring for all viewers.

The pair’s energetic and comedic routines have won over viewers (Picture: BBC)

But it was Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard who topped the leaderboard with a Frank Sinatra, New York New York Foxtrot, earning 38 points.

Strictly Come Dancing airs 6.40pm on Saturdays on BBC One.
